page.title: 02Trusham Village _1_
page.content: The population of this small village is about 170 and made up of a mixture of families who have lived there for generations and newcomers who commute to work in nearby towns. Whilst many amenities such as the school and post office have disappeared in recent years, a Devon longhouse was converted into a pub about three years ago. Children are bussed to school in nearby Chudleigh or Chudleigh Knighton and the parish church has a visiting Church of England vicar from nearby Christow who provide services for four parishes in the area. The actively supported village hall was bought four years ago from the church and is administered by an annually elected committee,who organise six to eight major events during the year and one or two events each week in winter.
